Description: Glazed composition amuletic figure, rather crudely executed, in the form of a ram couchant on a rectangular base, with a squarish suspension ring projecting from the back. The glaze is light brown with reddish patches.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, North-west Ptolemaic mound ?
Curator's comments: Probably one of the 2 "ram" among the "glazed pottery amulets of late work, probably late Ptolemaic", from the North-west mound, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79. The other one is London, BM, EA 20689.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 79) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.40, p.45, p.180, pl.22)
